messages.message: Team, the /v2/files/upload api is overly complicated. Who can i discuss this with? Having to figure out chunks and commits its not a good experience when we should be able to have a simple api that takes in a path, filename and payload.
this is kinda on the roadmap: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Yzp9BGkzteCtWiY7p2Mh548rYJFEL05-s4S6_CIszq0/edit#heading=h.gf02wd9197ai
Why not just use the v1 API - it is so simple and delivers the same result?
Well v2 api is fine from the put files api but the files/upload uri is new and the issue. I’d prefer we have our docs reflect the old way versus this new batch commit style.

The doc shared is the work we’re doing with batching folders of files in instabase to abstract away the IB file system from api users - multipart upload is the general reccommended approach for uploading files, and is being discussed in the other thread (https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C0516UPPMT3/p1706024739691999)
